item.title: Hidden Markov Models
item.description: This is a lecture note of Hidden Markov Models.

item.title: Markov Chains
item.description: This is the notes for the lecture of Markov Chains.

item.title: Markov Processes
item.description: This is a summary of the lecture notes of Markov Processes.

item.title: Stock Prices
item.description: This is a tutorial for stock prices in the context of random processes.

item.title: Possion Processes
item.description: This article is mainly about the Poisson processes in the book “Random Processes” by Gregory F. Lawler.

item.title: Random Walks
item.description: This article is a summary of the random walks in the book “Random Processes” by Gregory F. Lawler.

item.title: Stochastic Processes
item.description: Compared to deterministic model, which is specified by a set of equations that describe exactly how the system will evolve over time. In a stochastic model, the evolution is at least partially random and if the process is run several times, it will not give identical results.

item.title: Random Variables
item.description: This article introduces the common distribution functions both continuous and discrete. Besides, the basic knowledge of conditional distribution such as total probability and Bayes’ Theorem is also introduced. The most important part are the Normal Approximation and Poisson Approximation of the Binomial Random Variable.

item.title: Repeated Trials
item.description: This article is mainly about Bernoulli Trials and its properties.

item.title: Probability and Its Axioms
item.description: This article is about the probability and its axioms.
